description.narrative: New sustainable development solutions will be identified, aligned, tested and scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative:
1.1. Number of new data sources used at Country Office level 1.2. Diversity of different data sources used 1.3. Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4. Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses
2.1. Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP) 2.2. Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 2.3. Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 2.4. Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies
3.1. Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs 3.2. Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network 3.3. Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network 3.4. Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem

comment.narrative: • At least one full lab cycle (sense, explore, design and test) completed on an identified project by 2019

As the Lab began in Oct 2019, the last three months of 2019 were spent understanding our roles and responsibilities, and to identify the key challenge we aim to tackle. To enable this the lab conducted a grassroot innovation ecosystem mapping exercise by investigating grassroot innovation activities within 3 provinces in SA, and meeting with national and local stakeholders. The outcome was a report titled A Rapid Assessment of South Africa's Innovation Ecosystem: https://www.za.undp.org/content/south_africa/en/home/library/other-publications/rapid-assessment-report.html, which was launched in Jan 2020. AccLab South Africa also exhibited at the Department of Science and Innovation’s Science Forum and Innovation Bridge Conference, where we met with many local innovators and scientists. This event served as the AccLab soft Launch in December 2019, and helped spread the word of the work of the AccLab. Nov/Dec 2019 was also spent planning for the official lab launch in Jan 2020.

Target 1.1 10 new data sources per year. • Conduct futures research and share at least three emerging trends that could influence or inform programming. • Conduct at least 1 collective intelligence study. • Use at least 2 unusual data sources to inform AccLab solutions and experimentation. • Use research findings to identify levers for system change to assist in the design of portfolio approaches. •Conduct research on the AccLab’s frontier challenge areas, enhancing understanding of the major challenges facing South Africans and the South African government;
Target 1.2 9 different type of data sources per year. • Identify, contact, and develop relationships with at least 15 actors in the innovation ecosystem. • Formalise at least 2 “unusual” partnerships within public/private sector
Target 1.3 50 new potential solutions per lab per year. • Identify and document at least 5 solutions per 100-day lab-learning-cycle (15 per year) that impact on either water, energy, but primarily on food security. •Conduct field research monthly to surface new solutions directly from communities (dependant on Covid restrictions). When not possible, engage and establish sensor networks to identify and share relevant innovations. •Translate ethnographic and field research findings into learning and action for the lab activities; •Advise on the Accelerator Lab’s experiment portfolio to ensure experiments are designed based on people’s knowledge, behaviours, and peer to peer methods of managing and diffusing knowledge.
Target 1.4 10 innovation methods per Action Plan. • Assess shortlisted solutions against problem statements and formulate testable hypotheses (including control studies). • Test at least 3 hypotheses per 100-day lab learning cycle. (+- 11 hypotheses per year). •Develop a framework to capture the learning from the experiments that supports critical reflection and insights for scale/replication; •Examine the results from the testing of prototypes and translate them into proposals informing decisions on next steps, e.g. scaling options.
Target 2.1 Blog Tracker. • At least 8 blogs or other (substantial) media posts published per year.
Target 2.2 Partnerships and government. • At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. • Run two workshops with project partners employing AccLab tools and methodologies.
Target 2.3 At least one government entity or partner has or is in the process of adopting an accelerator lab method. •Run two workshops with project partners employing AccLab tools and methodologies.
Target 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies •At least 75% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. •Run one lecture/workshop on AccLab tools and methodologies. •Continue to Identify points of collaboration and cohesion between CO programmes/projects.
Target 3.1 The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. •48 interaction per year
Target 3.2 Knowledge dissemination amongst Accelerator Lab Network • 50% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related.
Target 3.3 Engagement of the broader development ecosystem • The Accelerator Lab Networks' work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. • The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account.
Target 3.4 Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. •Identify and engage with 10 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.
